txt_en: Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work.
txt_cn: 生活中沉稳可靠、井井有条，方能在工作中脱颖而出、不同凡响。
author: Gustave Flaubert

txt_en: We first make our habits, then our habits make us.
txt_cn: 我们养成习惯，接着习惯成就我们。
author: John Dryden

txt_en: Every individual has a place to fill in the world.
txt_cn: 每一个来到这个世界上的人，都有一个属于他自己的位置。
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

txt_en: If the moon smiled, she would resemble you.
txt_cn: 月亮要是笑起来，她就会和你一样。
author: Sylvia Plath

txt_en: The landscape belongs to the person who looks at it.
txt_cn: 风景属于那些看风景的人。
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

txt_en: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
txt_cn: 无论是你的过去，还是将来，与你的内在相比，都微不足道。
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

txt_en: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise and most possible.
txt_cn: 想要触摸天上星辰，志存高远；想要触碰心灵，明智且最可行。
author: Maya Angelou

txt_en: Half of the troubles of this life can be traced to saying yes too quickly and not saying no soon enough.
txt_cn: 生活中有半数烦恼，来自于答应得太快和拒绝得太慢。
author: Josh Billings
